content: I was just listening to Ron Kuby, 'Doing Time With Ron Kuby', on Air America. He just got done equating the Somali pirates with businessmen. He had said that upto this point it was jus a matter of paying a ransom, as if it was nothing more then a business expense. How they(the pirates) have been harmless!!! He also went on a bit of rant about how the French had killed the fellow being held hostage along with family & freinds on his yacht. Usually, I can take Ron. I kind of like his show, knowing he is totally wacked out his mind, neo-communist. But this twisting of events was nothing short of amazing. The sad part, he believes what he says.

content: I strangely find myself siding with the French and Obama at the same time (!?!). The only way to deal with piracy is by meeting it head on and destroying it. Yes, a French citizen died during their operation (I believe the first such casualty in three like operations). How many lives will be saved when the Somalis decided to go after softer targets than the French? Likewise because of the bold actions of our Navy SEALS (Go Navy!) many American ships and crews will be able to move securely through international waters. The tactic of willfully paying tribute, protection or ransom fails on the school yard, in the prison yard and on the international stage for the same reasons. It marks the payee as weak, it emboldens predators and it rewards unwanted behavior. Just as a punch in the nose will dissuade a schoolyard bully the actions taken lately against the pirates will have a positive effect. It also sends notice to others who would be willing victims; join the fight or be the only item on the menu.
